com.caoccao.javet.utils

Class V8Scope

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.caoccao.javet.utils.V8Scope
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IJavetClosable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class V8Scope
extends java.lang.Object
implements IJavetClosable
    The type V8 virtual escapable value is for preventing memory leak when exception is thrown. It needs to be used by try-with-resource. By default, escapable is set to false so that the internal value can be close when exception is thrown. If there is no exception, escapable needs to be set to true before try-with-resource is closed.

    Usage: 

     try (V8Scope v8Scope = new V8Scope()) {
     V8ValueObject v8ValueObject = v8Scope.add(v8Runtime.createV8ValueObject());
     // v8ValueObject will be closed automatically if there is an exception thrown.
     v8Scope.setEscapable();
     // v8ValueObject will not be closed.
     return v8ValueObject;
 }
    Since:
    0.9.13
